channel.title: Level Experience Algorithms
channel.description: Alright, I'm working with levelups (writing over the current yellow text with white text) and I need an integer to respresent the amount of exp to reach the next level. Now, instead of creating an int for every level and using those, I would like to work out an algorithm so I can use 1, clean int. Level 1: 0 Level 2: 83 Level 3: 174 Level 4: 276 Level 5: 388 Level 6: 512 Level 7: 650 Level 8: 801 Level 9: 969 Level 10: 1154 If you want to see 1-99, the chart is here: http://www.runehq.com/RHQSkills.php Note: This chart shows the exp you will have at that level, so to see the exp you will be going for when you're level 6, you must look at level 7. Don't say there isn't one, because making things realistic to jagex's I've come to notice simple algorithms in everything they do, and honestly just coming up with numbers like these out of thin-air doesn't seem logical. All input is appreciated.

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @i_own_pking i_own_pking
item.description:
@i_own_pking wrote:

Isn’t this the thing you would use? Its what defines the level’s already in servers;

points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0)); output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);

Also, to get it to display exp away something like

public int expAway = getXPForLevel(playerLevel[1]+1) - playerXP[1];

I was thinking of doing this before, but i couldn’t find the id for the frame showing exp.

But you could use a for loop and display in a method, such as

public void showexpaway() { for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { int expAway = getXPForLevel(playerLevel[i]+1) - playerXP[i]; } for(int z = Frame id start; i < frameidend; z++) { sendFrame126("Exp away: "+expAway); } }

Also, if this works, please tell me.

That last method will not work btw, it was just an example.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Lol, I decided to get it working the long way.

public int updateLevelExperience(int level) {
switch (level) {
case 1:
return 83;
break;
case 2:
return 174:
break;
//etc
}
}

lol

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @Aurai Aurai
item.description:
@Aurai wrote:

Tricky.
You may be able to coax Java into figuring it out for you by displaying the differences between the numbers, I’m not sure what you would do from there. I’ll give it a shot I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Yeah…that’s why I’m trying to figure out an algorithm?

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @Aurai Aurai
item.description:
@Aurai wrote:

You have to find a pattern on the increase of experience required to level up, the more you level up.
Once you have found that pattern, an easy for loop should do the trick.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

If anyone has another idea on how to do this besides an algorithm, by all means.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Hmm… Think you might be onto something with the first part of the equation.

playerLevel * 83 ...

It’s just the higher leveled experience I’d be worried about. At around 90 it shoots up.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

I’ve started to notice a pattern already…but it just doesn’t fit. Take the previous level number and times it by 83, then add 8 that many times. Works for 1, 2, and 3, and is off a bit from there on out.

Read full topic

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Hmm… Jagex’s equation for level-ups?

Gah… I hate their experience chart… This might take me awhile. Just looking at it makes my head hurt. I can guarantee if they use a decimal I’m not going to be able to find it.

item.title: Level Experience Algorithms
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Alright, I’m working with levelups (writing over the current yellow text with white text) and I need an integer to respresent the amount of exp to reach the next level. Now, instead of creating an int for every level and using those, I would like to work out an algorithm so I can use 1, clean int.
Level 1: 0
Level 2: 83
Level 3: 174
Level 4: 276
Level 5: 388
Level 6: 512
Level 7: 650
Level 8: 801
Level 9: 969
Level 10: 1154
If you want to see 1-99, the chart is here: http://www.runehq.com/RHQSkills.php
Note: This chart shows the exp you will have at that level, so to see the exp you will be going for when you’re level 6, you must look at level 7.
Don’t say there isn’t one, because making things realistic to jagex’s I’ve come to notice simple algorithms in everything they do, and honestly just coming up with numbers like these out of thin-air doesn’t seem logical. All input is appreciated.
